paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Mean age at onset 55.9 years, 5 males and 3 females
patients.phenotype: Mixed phenotype with severe axonal polyneuropathy, cardiac disease, and autonomic neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Severe axonal polyneuropathy, cardiac disease, and autonomic neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mean age at onset in these patients was 55.9 years, with early onset in only two of these patients (nos. 4 and 15, at 44 and 47.2 years of age, respectively).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Severe axonal polyneuropathy, cardiac disease, and autonomic neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The mean age at onset in these patients was 55.9 years, with early onset in only two of these patients (nos. 4 and 15, at 44 and 47.2 years of age, respectively).

functional_data.summary: The Asp38Ala mutation is associated with severe clinical manifestations including polyneuropathy and cardiac involvement.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as all carriers were affected.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The Asp38Ala mutation was the most common in this cohort.
key_quotes: The most-common mutation pattern in South Korea was Asp38Ala, which was detected in eight patients.
Eight patients with Asp38Ala had similar clinical symptoms, such as severe axonal polyneuropathy, cardiac disease, and autonomic neuropathy.

patients.phenotype: Similar symptoms including sensorimotor polyneuropathy and autonomic dysfunction

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two patients with Lys35Asn also shared similar symptoms including sensorimotor polyneuropathy and autonomic dysfunction.
Two patients with Lys35Asn also shared similar symptoms including sensorimotor polyneuropathy and autonomic dysfunction.

functional_data.summary: The Lys35Asn mutation is associated with similar clinical symptoms as other TTR mutations.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as both carriers were affected.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: Both patients with Lys35Asn exhibited similar symptoms.
key_quotes: Two patients with Lys35Asn also shared similar symptoms including sensorimotor polyneuropathy and autonomic dysfunction.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The other three late-onset patients (nos. 1, 5, and 11) were genotyped as Lys35Asn, Asp38Val, and Ala97Ser, respectively.

functional_data.summary: The Asp38Val mutation is associated with TTR amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as the carrier was affected.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The specific phenotype for this patient was not detailed.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The other three late-onset patients (nos. 1, 5, and 11) were genotyped as Lys35Asn, Asp38Val, and Ala97Ser, respectively.

functional_data.summary: The Ala97Ser mutation is associated with TTR amyloidosis.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation.
